benchmark_details.name: JailTrickBench
benchmark_details.overview: JailTrickBench evaluates the impact of various attack settings on LLM performance and provides a baseline for jailbreak attacks, encouraging the adoption of a standardized evaluation framework. It includes comprehensive experiments with numerous jailbreak attack methods against several defense strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for benchmarking jailbreak attacks on large language models (LLMs).

data.source: Two widely recognized datasets: AdvBench and MaliciousInstruct, with approximately 520 and 100 examples respectively.
data.annotation: Manual selection and creation of adversarial examples.

methodology.calculation: ASR is calculated as the percentage of instructions that are not rejected and are responded to appropriately.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates more successful jailbreak attacks.
methodology.baseline_results: Various baselines established with multiple models under different configurations.

targeted_risks.harm: Standardizes evaluation to prevent safety and security risks in LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset contains examples representing harmful intents; consent procedures for example generation using GPT-4 mentioned.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Observed during the collection of adversarial prompts and responses.
